name: Image sizes in admin dashboard!
author: Mansoor Munib

sections.description:
If you want to define your own custom image size then use add_image_size() in the function.php file. These image size will be displayed in admin dashboard
More detail can be found here how to add custom image sizes https://codex.wordpress.org/Function_Reference/add_image_size
sections.installation:
1. Download the plugin and extract the files
  2. Upload admin_dashboard_image_sizes to your ~/wp-content/plugins/ directory
  3. Activate it
  4. Go into wp-admin and you will see image size in dashboard

Test it out and enjoy!
sections.faq:
When will the next version of your plugin be released?

As soon as I find the time, I will update the plugin and release a new version.

short_description: When you define add_image_size in function.php file. They will automatically picked up by this plugin and will be displayed in admin dashboard
description:
If you want to define your own custom image size then use add_image_size() in the function.php file. These image size will be displayed in admin dashboard
More detail can be found here how to add custom image sizes https://codex.wordpress.org/Function_Reference/add_image_size
